title: How to Cook a Mediterranean Flavored Brisket in a Slow Cooker

steps.headline: Buy a 6-7 lb untrimmed beef brisket.
steps.description: It should have about ⁄2 inch (1.3 cm) of fat on the outside.

steps.headline: Unpackage and rinse the brisket well.
To make the rub.
steps.description: Mix the spices in a bowl.

steps.headline: Place the brisket in an aluminum roasting pan.
steps.description: Using your hands, rub the spice mixture all over and into the brisket firmly. Be sure to cover all surfaces. Salt and pepper to taste. Cover the roasting pan with foil or wrap and refrigerate overnight.

steps.headline: Remove the brisket from the roasting pan and place in your slow cooker.
steps.description: Be sure to scrape all the spices into your slow cooker.

steps.headline: Add 1/2 can of root beer.
steps.description: Set slow cooker on low and cook 9-10 hours.

text: Buy a 6-7 lb untrimmed beef brisket. It should have about ⁄2 inch (1.3 cm) of fat on the outside. Unpackage and rinse the brisket well.  To make the rub. Mix the spices in a bowl. Place the brisket in an aluminum roasting pan. Using your hands, rub the spice mixture all over and into the brisket firmly. Be sure to cover all surfaces. Salt and pepper to taste. Cover the roasting pan with foil or wrap and refrigerate overnight. Remove the brisket from the roasting pan and place in your slow cooker. Be sure to scrape all the spices into your slow cooker. Add 1/2 can of root beer. Set slow cooker on low and cook 9-10 hours. Finished.
